thread.title: “Does it fart” might be the most important science question of the week (13 Photos)
thread.title_full: “Does it fart” might be the most important science question of the week (13 Photos)

author: Shelbie
title: “Does it fart” might be the most important science question of the week (13 Photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
Oftentimes, Twitter can a place for scientists to connect with the public to educate us about the heavy-hitting subjects… for example, “Do snakes fart?” 2 
Daniella Rabaiotti, a PhD student at the Zoological Society of London, asked the question we all had no idea we’d been dying to know the answer to after a family member tested her knowledge. 3 
Auburn University ecologist David Steen came to the rescue and informed us all that yes, snakes do pass the gas. 4 
However the world was not satisfied with the confirmation of just one animal’s flatulence habits, so #DoesItFart was born, which caused scientists to really go above and beyond with a plethora of answers. 5 
Alabama University PhD candidate Nicholas Caruso went through all of the responses and compiled a Google spreadsheet that is available for everyone to enjoy. There are over 70 entries so far. “As you can see by the list most of the answers were ‘yes’, so a lot of animals fart – just like us,” he said. “I think it’s interesting how this may have started a new debate of ‘what is a fart’.” Advertisement Advertisement 6 
FYI, a few interesting animals that do not fart are parrots, sea anemone and shore crabs. 7 
However, anyone can edit the spreadsheet, so he warns that you must keep that in mind when reading the information. “Using a Google sheet that anyone can go in and edit seemed like the best way to get the most info as we can and engage as many people as possible,” Caruso said. “Obviously user-submitted responses not subject to any verification or oversight should be taken with a grain of salt.” 8 
The trend certainly opened our eyes to which animals are gassier than others. 9 10 
Another hashtag, #DoesItPuke, branched off from #DoesItFart and sparked a whole new conversation. There’s even a separate page for it in the Google doc. Advertisement
